tasks.task: Presenting the Agronomy Field Information Management System (AgroFIMS)
subtasks: Setup and customize experiment details (e.g., type of experiment, site, crop, design)
Input experimental treatments (e.g., fertilizers, nutrient amounts, application methods)
Specify crop measurements and units
Generate standardized field book for data collection
Integrate with KD Smart application for mobile data collection
Define agricultural experiments and processes (e.g., planting, fertilization, irrigation)
Classify agricultural implements and equipment
Catalog fertilizers and units of measurement
Develop a hierarchical structure for terms and relations
Collaborate with external ontologies (e.g., CHEBI, EnvO, plant ontology)

tasks.task: Using Ontologies and AGRO for Data Annotation
subtasks: Access AGRO ontology via websites or GitHub
Utilize Ontology Lookup Service (OLS) for term discovery
Employ Copo tool for automated data annotation
Store and aggregate data using AgroFIMS and CG Lab platforms
Conflict resolution and term creation in AGRO

tasks.task: Integrating AgroFIMS and AGRO into the Data Ecosystem
subtasks: Connect with existing data repositories (e.g., Guardian)
Facilitate data discovery and compliance with FAIR principles
Support for multiple Croptiles and experimental designs
Enhance data interoperability through standardized metadata
Collaborate with breeding management systems for integrated data
